Vocabulary.Bite: To use teeth to cut into something or someone.
Vocabulary.Bread: A type of food made from flour and baked in an oven.
Vocabulary.Kind: Being nice or thoughtful towards others.

Sentences.Text: One day, a man was bitten by a dog.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: How do you think the man felt after being bitten?
FunQuestions: How can you avoid being bitten by an animal?

Sentences.Text: The bite hurt a lot, and the man wanted to find someone to help him feel better.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the man will do next?
FunQuestions: What would you do if you were hurt?
Who do you ask for help when youâ€™re injured?

Sentences.Text: A friend saw him and said, 'I have an idea! Take some bread, dip it in the blood from your wound, and give it to the dog that bit you.'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the friend gave this idea?
FunQuestions: What would you do if a friend suggested something strange?
Do you think the dog's behavior will change?

Sentences.Text: The man laughed and said, 'Why would I do that? If I feed the dog, it will think biting me is good.'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the man is worried about?
FunQuestions: What would you say to someone who hurt you?
Is the man right to think this way?

Sentences.Text: He added, 'Then, maybe all the dogs in town will bite me too!'
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why is the man afraid of all the dogs?
FunQuestions: What would you do to stop all the dogs from biting?
Do you think dogs learn from each other?

Sentences.Text: The man learned that being kind to someone who hurts you might not always be a good idea.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What lesson did the man learn?
FunQuestions: What would you do in the man's place?
